There isnt much I can say other than that this is one of my favourite games of all time, having originally played through on the xbox I picked it up in the sale and blasted through again. My top tip, whenever someone starts talking stop moving, I heard so much more dialogue on my second playthrough and the last line said is opften the best. Moving on often stops the dialogue!
Awesome single player campaign, and really great coop play, it will challenge your brain.

I absolutely love the Portal series, and Portal 2 is a great sequal! The single-player puzzles are all unique and a lot of fun to solve, and the stroyline is fantastic, being narrated by characters who are all full of character! :D

The co-op mode also provides loads more fun puzzles (providing you can get through them without you and your teammate repeatedly killing each other :D)!

I originally finished this on Xbox, but the Steam version adds even more opportunity for fun with Steam Workshop, being able to play great puzzles from the community, and make them yourself!

I really reccomend this game to anone who likes problem solving, or to someone who wants to try to make some levels for a game but doesn't know where to start, as the Portal 2 editor is very easy to use!
Divertente, ma i livelli sono troppo pochi!
Un jeu tout juste énorme, le mode co-op se fini rapidement mais ajoute vraiment beaucoup à l'ambiance à la fois drole et sadique de ce jeu

Geniously challenging. This game offers puzzles that'll leave you puzzled and feeling so dumb when you solve them, but they always leave you with a sense of accomplishment. The characters are witty and charming. And when you're done with single player, grab a friend for an entirely different campaign of puzzles designed specifically for two people to solve. Incredibly fun.

Sinceramente no soy un fan de los juegos de puzzle pero PORTAL 2  me encanto, es una obra maestra de valve , es un juego con una gran historia (recomiendo que jueguen el PORTAL ya que en este continua la historia) con pocos personajes pero muy buenos personajes con los cuales el juego se torna divertido por la trama y las conversaciones que tenemos con estos, ademas de la historia y sus personajes la jugabilidad es muy buena . el juego nos reta con una cantidad de pruebas y eventos inesperados que nos pondran al limite de nuestra capacidad de reacción y de logica, es un juego que deben jugar sin dudarlo.

Al terminar el juego senti un vacio, es un buen juego y realmente vale la pena que lo compren y lo disfruten.

Portal 2 is the best game I've ever played. The story is immersive, the idea is original and interesting, the gameplay is innovative, and you're not going to want to quit until you finish.

Si Portal te gustó, Portal 2 te encantará, porque añade todo tipo de cosas más allá de portales para comerte la cabeza (geles, láseres, puentes...). Además el juego tiene muchísimos puntazos de humor, como los torrotos o el propio Weatley. Muy, muy bueno.

Portal 2 est un très bon jeu. Les salles sont bien construites et impose un certain challenge.
Glados est juste excellente (j'ai fais le jeu en anglais, je ne sais pas ce que ça donne exactement en français, mais si, les traductions sont bien faites, Glados est excellente) et extrement sarcastique. L'atmosphere est géniale : Humour, challenge; il y a l'aspect irréaliste et original du premier combiné à l'idiotie et soif de pouvoir de Weathley en plus d'une diversité plus grande des salles. 
Point négatif : Malgré le challenge du jeu, Valve a préféré miser un peu plus sur la quantité que sur la qualité, c'est-à-dire que même si certaines salles soit un peu dures le jeu reste somme toute assez facilement réalisable avec un peu d'acharnement. (Je parle uniquement du solo).

La suite de Portal. Le jeu est toujours un puzzle game de style FPS. Le mode histoire est beaucoup plus grand et est une suite du premier jeu. Il y a un mode coopératif et des défis. On peut construire des chambres de test, les partager et jouer des chambres de test fait par d'autres joueurs.

Great game, don't know why I waited so long to play it since I loved the original Portal so much. Definite replay value and a much longer storyline than the original.

Portal 1 was the original reason I bought the Orange Box back in the day. Portal 2 lived up to the hype at the time, expanding upon the original greatly with its puzzles, story, and setting.

Coming back to it recently, the game is much easier than I remember, but it still holds up. The co-op can be fun with new players, and there is a lot of user made content in the Steam Workshop.

Easily one of the greatest games ever made. I highly doubt you will ever find a game as funny, puzzling, and just plain enjoyable to play as Portal 2. With a story that takes interesting twists, to its fascinating gameplay, this game should be played by anyone who enjoys games themselves.

(POSSIBLE SPOILERS, BUT I'M TRYING TO AVOID ANY) Portal 2 is a pretty good game. I love how it looks, plays, and most of the puzzles. The enviorments are nice for the most part, even the small characters have specific and memorable personalities, and there were moments that made me shocked. However, there are a lot of problems with this game. My first major complaint is that they remove so many of the portal-able surfaces making it turn into a game of Spot the Surface than Portal 2. That happens mainly because of the enviorments being forced and eventually becoming bland. A big room is cool with the soundtrack for the first two times, but eventually becomes overused. The next issue I have is the puzzles. The puzzles later on are meant to be peiced together, but it's still annoying when you are pretty much trained to look for every and any solution possible just to have these come along and make you overthink everything. There was one puzzle near the very end where I had to go to one side of death water to press button and then do this and that and go there and avoid the turrets and it just became too much. This game isn't that easy to replay. I have only played a bit of the story as I have already compleated it on my Xbox copy before I got Steam. I guess it's good, but not such an amazing game that I would say it's better that Portal 1. If I had to rate it from 1 to 10 (1 being worst, 10 being best), I'd give it a 9. Almost there, but not quite.

Pros: Fast-paced and well-crafted story with twists, memorable characters explored and huge Aperture Science Facility, complete with backstory. Co-op is the best co-op I've played, genuinely collaborative, requiring synced actions at its hardest. Several new science tools to play around with, like light bridges, air funnels and gels(speed, jump and one for making surfaces portal-friendly). Co-op and SP have their own storyline and characters; they relate to one another, but without either spoiling the other. Level editor with leaderboards. Hilarious comedy, without losing drama and threat.

Cons: More characters and dialog mean less isolation and loneliness, which were part of the appeal of the first(all alone, with a psychotic AI, in a deadly facility).

My recommendation: Even if you don't think you're that good at puzzle games(I'm not), play this. The only people who shouldn't are those who don't like the dark comedy - watch a trailer to see if that aspect appeals to you or not.

Why are you reading this?  Have you been living in a cave or something?  Buy the damn game already, it's a timeless masterpeice.  

Also, there is a bevy of high quality, pre-vetted, user created content.  I play a few levels a month since the feature was introduced and have yet to experience any repeat content.  This game is an extremely good value and a heck of a lot of fun.

This game is just a masterpiece. A great plot with brilliant dialogues and a really original playability based on physics.
If you're looking for a completely original puzzle game with a medium-high difficulty play Portal 2. You can even create your own test chambers (feel like GLaDOS) and download other players creations! And its cooperative mode is really good too! :D
Just play and have fun! ;)

P.D: Play Portal before playing Portal 2, obviously :P

Portal 2 est un jeu a la fois de pseudo-plateforme , et de reflexion . Il faut comprendre et réfléchir ,  et savoir utilisé la partie de son cerveau adapté ;) ! Si vous y joué sans y prendre gout , j vous conseil de passé votr chemin , mais si comme moi vous passé  au derniers chapitres et que vous restez coincé dans un mur , j'ai quitter et j'ai du recommencé au début , cela n'empêche pas que le jeu en lui même est propres et que grace au Workshop , on peux jouer , et créer nos map via le jeu . Je ne re le regrette pas , je ne peux que vous le connseillez !
